title: Breakfast at Tiffany's (3/9) Movie CLIP - Moon River (1961) HD

comments.text: Il 4 maggio 1929 nasceva #AudreyHepburn, icona di stile ed eleganza.﻿
comments.author: La Bottega di Hamlin

comments.text:
El 4 de mayo de 1929 nació la actriz Audrey Hepburn 
.. "Para tener hermosos ojos, mira por el bien de los demás. Para tener 
hermosos labios, pronuncia solo palabras de bondad. Y para el equilibrio, 
camina con la certeza de que nunca estás sola."
Audrey Hepburn﻿
comments.author: Maria Nilda Silva Lotero

comments.text: Happy birthday, Audrey!﻿
comments.author: Aluísio Oliveira

comments.text:
As a kid I was huge fan of Andy Williams. but I never liked his song Moon 
River.
He sang it in a very strong theatrical way. It never meant anything to me.
I saw Breakfast at Tiffany's a few years ago having never seen it before.
When I saw Audrey Hepburn's version of it, it completely changed my feeling 
about the song. She made me realize that the song was about a young 
person's longing for a brighter future. Makes me realize how much influence 
a director has on getting a message across.﻿
comments.author: Pianoman 70s style

comments.text:
+Pianoman 70s style I agree. the song is meant to be soft and melancholy, 
not swingy and theatrical. Henry Mancini himself said that of all the 
covers of "Moon River" he had heard, Audrey's was the best, because she 
completely understood the meaning of the song. Side note: after Audrey saw 
BAT with the music for the first time, she wrote Henry Mancini a letter of 
praise in which she called him "the Hippest of Cats" she was so sweet!

comments.author: iZuqoo

comments.text:
This is so beautiful, and even though Audrey had a really thin voice, 
emotionally it is so powerful. She was desperate to sing all the parts for 
`My Fair Lady', but the producers got Marnie Nixon to sing for her. I think 
it's a great shame, as we will never know if the `MFL' might have even been 
more overwrought had `A. H.' been allowed to sing the parts﻿
comments.author: Kevin Hill

comments.text: Before I saw this movie I thought Marilyn Monroe sung this song ﻿
comments.author: Anthony Perdomo

comments.text:
One of my favourite Elvis song ever, Can't Help Falling in Love from that 
movie Blue Hawaii, would get my vote to win the Oscar in many other years. 
But not 1961, where it would sadly stalled as my number two choice. After 
all, Moon River is Moon River, and you just can't go wrong with it. And 
thankfully, neither did the Academy at the time. A supremely deserving win.﻿

comments.author: nataliem95

comments.text:
Of all the songs I've ever heard written for films, this has to be one of 
THE BEST ever written! The lyrics are simply amazing: so bittersweet, 
poetic and evocative!  Every time I hear it I'm filled with such a strange 
yearning for something I know I will never find in this lifetime, something 
I'm not even able to name. This is NOT a frivolous, lightweight song by any 
means, yet sadly so many singers perform it as exactly that...and it pisses 
me off when they do! God, what a masterpiece this song is, even Hepburn's 
god-awful performance of it cannot alter its innate beauty!﻿
comments.author: Babyhowdy233

comments.text:
